alert.note: Alert for St. Tammany; Washington (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 11 at 6:38PM CST until January 18 at 6:00AM CST by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Louisiana...Mississippi... Pearl River Near Bogalusa affecting Hancock, Pearl River, St. Tammany and Washington Counties. For the Lower Pearl River...including Bogalusa...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE FRIDAY NIGHT TO WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Pearl River Near Bogalusa. * WHEN...From late Friday night to Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 18.5 feet, Woodlands and crop acreage along the river will be flooded. The Bogue Chitto Wildlife Management area will be inundated with water in recreational camps and over access roads. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:00 PM CST Wednesday the stage was 17.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage early Saturday morning to a crest of 18.5 feet early Monday morning. It will then fall below flood stage early Wednesday morning, January 18. - Flood stage is 18.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 18.5 feet on 02/07/1959. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/lix. Click on the Rivers and Lakes menu for forecasts and observations. The next statement will be issued Thursday morning.
